meanings.definition: Treat (a person, group, or concept) as insignificant or peripheral.
meanings.sent1: She was always marginalizing her younger brother during playtime.
meanings.sent2: The company's decision to downsize ended up marginalizing many employees.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be marginalizing the new toy in favor of the old one.
meanings.sent4: The weeds in the garden were marginalizing the beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's constant interruptions were marginalizing the shy students in class.

meanings.definition: To relegate to an unimportant or powerless position.
meanings.sent1: The supervisor was marginalizing the new employee by giving them menial tasks.
meanings.sent2: The dictator's regime was known for marginalizing any dissenting voices.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was marginalizing the scarecrow by stealing its hat.
meanings.sent4: The storm was marginalizing the once sturdy tree, bending it to its will.
meanings.sent5: The villain's plan involved marginalizing the hero to ensure their victory.

meanings.sent1: The popular group in school was marginalizing anyone they deemed unworthy.
meanings.sent2: The committee's decision to marginalize certain members led to internal conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was marginalizing the cat by stealing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were marginalizing the sun, casting a shadow over the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise was marginalizing the speaker, making it hard for the audience to hear.
